string-array.name: imports_onboarding_google_steps
string-array.item: To export codes from Google Authenticator, you\'ll need to use the app\'s built-in \"Transfer accounts\" feature, which generates a QR code for transferring accounts to a new device.

string-array.name: imports_onboarding_2fas_steps
string-array.item: Open 2FAS Authenticator and enter the \"Settings\" section.
Enter the Export tool and click the \"Export to file\" button.

string-array.name: imports_onboarding_aegis_steps
string-array.item: To export codes from Aegis Authenticator, navigate to the app\'s Settings, find the \"Import & Export\" section, and select the export option.
You can choose to export as an encrypted database, or as a plain text file.

string-array.name: imports_onboarding_bitwarden_steps
string-array.item: To export data from Bitwarden Authenticator, open the \"Settings\" tab and tap the \"Export\" button.
You can choose to export your data as a .json or .csv file.

string-array.name: imports_onboarding_ente_steps
string-array.item: To export data from Ente Auth, open the \"Settings\" tab and look for \"Import/Export\" options.
Tap \"Export Codes\" and then \"Ente Encrypted export\".
This creates an encrypted backup file (usually .ente or .json) containing all your codes.

string-array.name: imports_onboarding_lastpass_steps
string-array.item: To export 2FA codes (TOTP) from LastPass, you\'ll need to export your vault data as a CSV file.
Open the LastPass browser extension and log in. Go to Account → Fix a problem yourself → Export vault items → Export data for use anywhere.

string-array.name: imports_onboarding_proton_authenticator_steps
string-array.item: To export codes from Proton Authenticator, navigate to the app\'s settings, find the \"Manage your data\" section, and select the export option.

string-array.name: imports_onboarding_unsupported_steps
string-array.item: Unfortunately, %1$s doesn’t currently support exporting data from their app. Consider contacting %1$s to request this feature.
Please import your data manually for now.
